title: "Liverpool NEED Daniel Sturridge": Steven Gerrard says he can't see striker leaving Anfield anytime soon
text:
Liverpool "need" Daniel Sturridge, according to Steven Gerrard. 
The Reds legend made the claim, which you can see in the above BT Sport video, while discussing the striker's future at his former club under Jurgen Klopp. 
Sturridge has struggled for game time this season with the German favouring the three-pronged attack of Philippe Coutinho, Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino. 
But Gerrard still believes the England international has a part to play at Anfield and cannot see the striker leaving anytime soon. Steven Gerrard says Liverpool need Daniel Sturridge (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Gerarrd praises Sturridge's minute-to-goal ratio for Liverpool (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Sturridge played 76 minutes of Liverpool's 1-0 victory over Plymouth in their FA Cup third round replay on Wednesday night. 
Speaking after the game, Gerrard sang his praises, saying: "One thing for sure is Liverpool will not let him go for cheap. 
"Liverpool need him, he scores goals when he plays, his minute-to-goal ratio is incredible. Sturridge has struggled for game time under Jurgen Klopp this season (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
"I'm sure if someone came along with a huge, huge offer and Daniel wanted it then I'm sure there could be a solution there. 
"But as it stands right now, Liverpool need Daniel Sturridge and I can't see him going anywhere short term."
